Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery volute-krater; interior: top of neck reserved, glazed black with band in added red below; top of rim reserved as far as preserved; on edge of rim key maeander running left; on neck, between single bands, black-figure decoration; at left, foreparts of horses (with added red manes) of quadriga to right with dog beside them; in front, bearded archer, to right, looking back wearing cap, short chiton, quiver (faded colour for strap) and bow; to right, bearded man in himation (red beard and dot on cloak) seated facing left on a block and holding a spear in his right hand; at far right, part of bird, to right and probably looking back; neck glazed below.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the volute krater Boston 90.153 in Richter, G. M. A. and Milne, M. J., Shapes and Names of Athenian Vases. New York 1935, fig. 50.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.22)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 285-6, no. B256)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0179) (Phase 1)
